channel.title: Developer Commentary
channel.description: So..... about developer commentaries in Black Mesa. After seeing the commentaries of Hezus' Uplink remake, what are your thoughts on this? Should it be included or not (if they have at all?).

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: John_Lemon
item.description:
Oh, my bad. :\ It’d be nice if we could get a dev’s opinion or word on the subject, but they’re all probably busy jizzing all over Xen.

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
John_Lemon:

Didn’t James say “A few of us, including myself, are working on commentaries”?

Yeah, a year and a half ago. We don’t know if they’re going to do it though, it’s been a long time and I doubt the chances have gotten any better.

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: John_Lemon
item.description:
Didn’t James say “A few of us, including myself, are working on commentaries”?

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
Last I heard, it was a consideration, but not likely. This was a very long time ago though, and I can’t imagine our chances would be going up as time went on.

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Are you implying it should be? Because it shouldn’t. They have absolutely no obligations to anyone at all.

Also, I seem to remember a dev saying they were discussing it and that some devs wanted to do it, but I’m not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: Dr_Maxwell
item.description:
They’re not going to do commentary. I’m pretty sure that they’ve said it. Making people happy is not a priority for the Black Mesa dev team.

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Walking around a bunch of black levels having every change explained away before you even see it.

Sign me up.

Read full topic

item.description:

That’ll be fun.

item.dc:creator: RAMacindux
item.description:
Sure Xen and Deathmatch are more important, but I think commentaries are the best way to understand the changes and decisions upon the different areas of the game.

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: elivance
item.description:
I hope that they’ll do it.
Raminator stated something about it while ago.

In the end, it’s source engine:
why do not use one of the most interesting feature of this engine?

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: MrSnaztastic
item.description:
Developer commentary was one of the things I was most looking forward to whilst Black Mesa was still unreleased. I knew the game would be great no matter what, but was excited to hear their reasoning behind what they changed and the processes they went through over such a long development. Was kinda sad when I first loaded up and saw there wasn’t any commentary, they must have some great “war stories” they could tell…

On that note, what happened to those posts Raminator said they’d do showing the progression of different levels over the years?

Read full topic

item.title: Developer Commentary
item.dc:creator: Artic_Xiongmao
item.description:
Yes, please! I’d rather have commentaries than Xen even. I know that dichotomy doesn’t make sense, but it shows how important it is to me. Since Black Mesa is a modern re-imagining of a classic, the process of its creation is just as interesting (if not more so, in some ways) as the experience of the finished product itself.

So, yes, I’m happy they’re working on Xen, but I’d be ecstatic If I knew that we would be hearing the dev’s voices on the myriad of decisions they had to make. Think about it. It’s not only the technical sides of level design, but how they tried to give those levels a better sense of “place” by making them more authentic, and how they expanded the script without falling on fanboyism (“ooooh, here’s Breen saying hello”.)

To sum up: I really, really hope that at least some of the devs take some time to give us at least some developer commentaries.

Read full topic
